meanings.definition: A utensil with a deep bowl-shaped end for serving or transferring food.
meanings.sent1: I used the scoopers to serve ice cream at the party.
meanings.sent2: The chef grabbed the scoopers to transfer the soup into bowls.
meanings.sent3: The scoopers clinked together as they scooped up the mashed potatoes.
meanings.sent4: Her hands moved like scoopers, swiftly gathering the fallen leaves.
meanings.sent5: The scoopers gleamed under the bright kitchen lights.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that scoops or gathers something up.
meanings.sent1: The little girl was the fastest of all the scoopers in the sandcastle contest.
meanings.sent2: The bird was a skilled scooper, collecting twigs for its nest.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon acted like a sneaky scooper, stealing the cookies from the jar.
meanings.sent4: His hands were like scoopers, swiftly picking up the scattered toys.
meanings.sent5: The robot was programmed to be a precise scooper of tiny electronic components.

meanings.definition: A machine or device used for scooping or excavating material.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers operated the heavy scoopers to dig the foundation.
meanings.sent2: The excavator was a powerful scooper, moving large amounts of dirt effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The robotic scoopers whirred as they dug into the ground, searching for buried treasure.
meanings.sent4: The giant scoopers of the crane lifted the debris from the construction site.
meanings.sent5: The mechanical scoopers worked tirelessly to clear the snow from the road.
